title: xLays
author: xLays
content: Since it's been 13 years since BitcoinTalk Founder Satoshi was last active on BitcoinTalk, I have some questions; Do you think he's still around and holding Bitcoin? What do you think about Satoshi Nakamoto right now? Do you believe he's still involved or has Bitcoin? What's your opinion on the mystery around Satoshi's identity and role in crypto? Do you think it's important for Satoshi to stay anonymous for the crypto market's stability? In case Satoshi came back from no where and reveal his identity what to you think will be the impact to crypto space?

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: I think he is so much alive and even holds more bitcoin in a separate wallet away from public eyes, which could link to him.¬†Oh yes, he might even be active here on this forum, and no one will know he is the one; he could probably be you or me; we can never be too sure. The point is, he just wants to remain anonymous, and that has been achieved over the years, and I believe it will still continue.¬†For the aspect of him coming out and revealing himself, who even wants that? If eventually he does and there is solid evidence that he is, he might probably get arrested or invited for questioning by the so-called regulatory bodies of world powers.¬†His last active date on the forum is the birthday of someone close to me. What a coincidence and a good way to keep that in my memory.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: Quote from: xLays on December 13, 2023, 10:22:21 AM¬† Do you think it's important for Satoshi to stay anonymous for the crypto market's stability? In case Satoshi came back from no where and reveal his identity what to you think will be the impact to crypto space?It's hard to say if he's alive or not, making the question quite challenging to answer. If he is alive, he likely has a significant amount of Bitcoins in other wallets, observing the Bitcoin scene like a show on his laptop. Staying anonymous seems wise, especially given the increased attention from government bodies on Bitcoin. To stay safe, it might be better for him to keep a low profile and enjoy his Bitcoins, just like any other Bitcoin enthusiast.QuoteIn case Satoshi came back from no where and reveal his identity what to you think will be the impact to crypto space?It could have both good and bad effects on Bitcoin and crypto space at Large. More investors might put money into Bitcoin, making its value go up and benefiting those who already own Bitcoin. But there's a risk. if there are a lot of accusations and pressure from government bodies, there's a chance he might be forced to change things. Maybe they'll take away the decentralization in Bitcoin, which is an important part of why Bitcoin was created. I think decentralization upsets the government more when it comes to Bitcoin.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: In fact, Satoshi did not post a single topic on this forum. bitcoin forum moved to BitcoinTalk in 2011 after Satoshi‚Äôs disappeared.The first account was admin account, which may be managed by Satoshi. the date of creating the Bitcoin forum is slightly earlier than the date of creating Satoshi‚Äôs account.Quote from: https://www.whois.com/whois/bitcointalk.orgDomain: bitcointalk.orgRegistrar: NameCheap, Inc.Registered On: 2011-06-24Expires On: 2029-06-24Updated On: 2019-11-24

comments.author: Churchillvv
comments.body: Firstly, I don't see any reason why we should be trying so hard to find who is Satoshi Nakamoto because it's has been a decade and 3 years since his/her/them did their part in human existence and has not been found till now so no need of wasting ones time try to know how he is. Secondly, with my view on what Bitcoin is (my own point of view) it's just another evolution that time has brought through some he/she/them to the world. just like paper money the Identity of the creator of paper money has been anonymous till date it only record the first time it was spent and looking at it from my subjectivity it has the same story line with Bitcoin which I have concluded that Bitcoin founder will never be known same way paper money founder is not known. To all the questions OP I usually say this; Hey man! wake up from such dreams....üòÅ Your imaginary questions are too wild I can't answer them all.

comments.author: Shishir99
comments.body: Quote from: xLays on December 13, 2023, 10:22:21 AMSNIPThis is the most accurate/correct answer you have ever seen regarding Satoshi.Satoshi could be a single person or could be a group of people. Satoshi could be a Man or woman, at least Human for sure. Satoshi might be in this forum, might not be in this forum. Satoshi might hold a significant amount of BTC, but might not hold. Maybe theymos is satoshi, maybe not. Maybe he is still alive, or maybe not. Maybe he saw the thread you created and cursing you for attempt to him or maybe not. Final question, If someone want to stay away from you, should you try to find him?

comments.author: Wapfika
comments.body: Quote from: xLays on December 13, 2023, 10:22:21 AM Do you think he's still around and holding Bitcoin? What do you think about Satoshi Nakamoto right now? Do you believe he's still involved or has Bitcoin? What's your opinion on the mystery around Satoshi's identity and role in crypto? Do you think it's important for Satoshi to stay anonymous for the crypto market's stability? In case Satoshi came back from no where and reveal his identity what to you think will be the impact to crypto space?I believe we will not see anymore the founder being active or else he will be a target for a crackdown like DoJ, SEC and so on since he is holding huge amount Bitcoin that doesn‚Äôt have tax for a long time especially if he is a US citizen.I think he is still active using different account in the sideline and have a backup Bitcoin funds that he save on separate wallet that‚Äôs why he can live without touching all his original holdings since he is still a human with desire on wealth.

comments.author: ineedhelpplease
comments.body: Quote from: xLays on December 13, 2023, 10:22:21 AMSince it's been 13 years since BitcoinTalk Founder Satoshi was last active on BitcoinTalk, I have some questions; Do you think he's still around and holding Bitcoin? What do you think about Satoshi Nakamoto right now? Do you believe he's still involved or has Bitcoin? What's your opinion on the mystery around Satoshi's identity and role in crypto? Do you think it's important for Satoshi to stay anonymous for the crypto market's stability? In case Satoshi came back from no where and reveal his identity what to you think will be the impact to crypto space?1. I'm very sure he's still holding Bitcoin. That would absolutely suck to be him if he did not.2. I believe that he's just vanished into the night. Looking at this stuff and what we have to say. I'm quite surprised even with his full name and stuff we still cannot find him. Especially seeing as how big Crypto is, surely there's gotta be some leads.3. I'm unsure if it's important for him to stay anonymous. 4. If he came back I feel like it would be huge big news, maybe crypto hype?5. I feel like he used a GMX.com email purposefully so someone could recreate it years later. Seeing how in the Bitcointalk database his email literally is "satoshin@gmx.invalid" he knew about the risks of using GMX.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: Just another Satoshi topic... Personally, I don't like such kind of topics because we only can speculate and predict as we don't know almost anything. In these 13 years of inactivity it didn't become clear what happened to Satoshi, whether he is alive or not and etc. I doubt that we will get answer in next 13 years and maybe it will be mystery forever.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: It seems the crypto community will never get tired of this question ‚ÄúWhere is Satoshi?‚Äù I think it‚Äôs in everyone‚Äôs best interest that Satoshi Nakamoto remains anonymous. If for any reason, Satoshi identity becomes public anti bitcoin governments will finally have someone to target in their quest to regulate bitcoin. They might go as far as labeling him/them a terrorist. Since there is no trace and personal information of Satoshi, it‚Äôs fair to say everyone hodling bitcoin is Satoshi.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: ineedhelpplease on December 13, 2023, 02:28:34 PM5. I feel like he used a GMX.com email purposefully so someone could recreate it years later. Seeing how in the Bitcointalk database his email literally is "satoshin@gmx.invalid" he knew about the risks of using GMX.Accessing that email is useless. The forum has been hacked twice and most of the old accounts have been locked. Without signing a message from one of the addresses that Satoshi owned, there is nothing that can confirm the identity of the account owner.Quote from: LTU_btc on December 13, 2023, 09:24:00 PMJust another Satoshi topic... Personally, I don't like such kind of topics because we only can speculate and predict as we don't know almost anything. In these 13 years of inactivity it didn't become clear what happened to Satoshi, whether he is alive or not and etc. I doubt that we will get answer in next 13 years and maybe it will be mystery forever.It is supposed to be a memorial, but some of the information provided is inaccurate.

comments.author: BabyBandit
comments.created_time: December 14, 2023, 03:07:12 AMLast edit: December 14, 2023, 03:44:49 AM by BabyBandit
comments.body: Quote from: xLays on December 13, 2023, 10:22:21 AMSince it's been 13 years since BitcoinTalk Founder Satoshi was last active on BitcoinTalk, I have some questions; Do you think he's still around and holding Bitcoin? What do you think about Satoshi Nakamoto right now? Do you believe he's still involved or has Bitcoin? What's your opinion on the mystery around Satoshi's identity and role in crypto? Do you think it's important for Satoshi to stay anonymous for the crypto market's stability? In case Satoshi came back from no where and reveal his identity what to you think will be the impact to crypto space?If he would come back and see what this creation turned into he would have been very disappointed.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: We are all satoshi, plain and simple. We didn't come up with the code, but we keep the dream alive everyday.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on December 14, 2023, 11:32:25 AMWe are all satoshi, plain and simple. We didn't come up with the code, but we keep the dream alive everyday. Yeah, I believe yahoo62278 is right we are all keeping the dream of Satoshi alive and in a sense we're all Satoshi. The original founder of Bitcoin made Bitcoin for us and left it for us so he may not get extra priority for his innovation. Such a brilliant mind and a freedom lover, where-ever in the world he is I would thank him for Bitcoin.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Satoshi Nakamoto has been inactive on the forum for more than a decade now, 13 years to be precise, but what more to be celebrated now is the fact that his legacy never ends, we are all part of the whole network and we keep moving it forward through our adoption and commitments, bitcoin network has always been with this consistency that it never got attacked or changed to be from what it's protocols had been program for, we are happy that we have bitcoin today even despite the absence of Satoshi, bitcoin remains more valuable to us now.
